description:
Financial Services Client
Initial 6 month Contract
100% Remote, USA

Data Analyst

Job Description:
o Conduct comprehensive reviews and analyses of data management solutions and data storage within folders to accurately identify data owners.
• Collaborate with various stakeholders to assess and document their data access requirements in detail.
• Support engineers in restructuring data folder hierarchies to ensure that data access is strictly limited to authorized personnel.
• Continuously monitor and maintain the integrity of data access across all organizational folder structures.
• Assist in the design and implementation of procedures for granting access during new folder creation.
• Provide accurate and timely status reports regarding data collection efforts and overall progress.
Job Expectations:
o Evaluate information, requirements, data, work quality, methodologies, processes, service-specific practices, standards, and metrics/statistics with advanced analytical techniques.
• Interpret analytical outcomes and present well-founded recommendations, including alternatives and their potential implications, ensuring moderate organizational impact.
• Collaborate with other business units to assess and enhance processing procedures, as well as to resolve operational issues with a focus on continuous improvement.
• Analyze policy, procedural, and product changes to determine their effects on group functions using advanced methods.
• Identify and evaluate opportunities for new or improved processes, data, or technology, providing comprehensive insights into potential outcomes through advanced analysis.
• Partner with peers, business units, project teams, and vendors to effectively communicate, document, and fulfill business requirements, supporting leadership initiatives as needed.
• Monitor and assess key performance indicators and establish robust processes and methodologies for preventative measures utilizing advanced analytics.
• Compile, review, and prepare data sets for use by analysts and management in evaluating operations, services, and products, particularly for complex or difficult analyses.
• Conduct benchmarking, perform trend analyses, and integrate findings to promote continuous improvement and elevate service performance, generating moderate organizational impact.
• Leverage analytical findings to propose data-driven hypotheses and actionable recommendations through sophisticated analysis.
• Address business challenges by clearly defining problems, engaging stakeholders, identifying and assessing options, and formally presenting conclusions, managing moderately complex and varied scenarios.
• Contribute to the development and refinement of best practices for the respective functional area.
• Ensure strict adherence to established IT policies, procedures, standards, and recognized best practices.
Qualifications:
o Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience
• Strong knowledge of IT policies and procedures
• Demonstrated ability to maintain accuracy and attention to detail while meeting deadlines
• Extensive experience in developing and delivering IT solutions with a focus on enhanced business intelligence
• Proven expertise in research, analysis, and problem-solving
• Advanced organizational, planning, and time management capabilities
• Excellent communication skills across all levels of an organization
• Demonstrated experience working effectively within cross-functional, multi-disciplinary teams and projects
• Advanced proficiency in presenting findings, conclusions, alternatives, and information in a clear and concise manner
• Well-developed relationship building, negotiation, and facilitation abilities
• Experience in leading, guiding, and mentoring colleagues
• Strong initiative and sound judgment in decision-making
• Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
• Advanced capability to analyze and structure problems or workflows to develop technical solutions
• Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously
• Capacity to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment
• Significant experience translating business requirements into effective technical solutions

A Data Analyst gathers, processes, and analyzes data to help organizations make informed decisions. They identify trends, patterns, and insights through data visualization and reporting
1. Strong knowledge of data analysis tools (Excel)
2. Experience with data visualization skills (Power BI, Tableau)
3. Strong attention to detail
4. Statistical analysis knowledge

description:
Position Summary

The Democratic National Committee’s Tech team is hiring Data Analysts to support analytics needs across DNC programs, with a focus on developing sustainable systems that allow us to optimize these efforts throughout the 2026 election cycle and beyond.

Who We Are

We are a fully remote, distributed team living in 19 states and from a variety of backgrounds. Some of us have worked in political campaigns, others in public sector tech, and others in industry. We value diversity in perspective, lived experience, and the many paths one may take into working in political technology. We believe deeply in the promise of breaking the boom-bust cycle of political tech work and building technology infrastructure that will support campaigns from cycle to cycle and will improve with every iteration.

Responsibilities

We’re looking for Data Analysts to support analytics across various DNC departments, such as the Fundraising and Distributed Organizing teams. This role will focus on using analytics to support program work – including leveraging data to run targeted outreach programs, building and maintaining reporting to track program health, and analyzing program outcomes to optimize program over time.

Among other things, in this role you could help us with:


 * Targeting: Manage targeting and outreach list management.
 * Reporting: Build and maintain automated reporting to empower our team with key insights into program performance. Work with engineering teams to consult on data products that can be used to streamline reporting code.
 * Strategic Analysis: Perform analysis to understand trends in engagement, areas of program strength, and opportunities for improvement; turn this analysis into actionable insights to optimize where we are focused over time.
 * Stakeholder Management: Work with DNC stakeholders to develop and implement data standards to support consistent data entry and storage across data tools.
 * Automation: Work with Tech Team stakeholders to develop products that streamline repetitive processes, such as targeting, universe development, and list movement between tools; consult on data products that can be used to streamline reporting code and other system automation.
 * Ad Hoc Work: Manage ad hoc data requests from stakeholders, ensuring quick turnaround while maintaining data accuracy and quality.
   
   

Preferred Skills And Qualifications


 * You are proficient in SQL and comfortable reasoning about very large datasets.
 * You have experience tackling new, messy datasets, and structuring them for quick analysis and insights; you understand the importance of establishing data standards and unifying multiple sources of data to track program progress and optimize work over time.
 * You are comfortable communicating the results of analysis to a wide range of stakeholders, including through routine reporting and leveraging data visualization tools like Looker Studio, Looker, Tableau, or Periscope.
 * You can turn independent analysis projects into sustainable, documented workflows, and have experience building systems that can be used across teams and are designed with longevity in mind.
 * You are curious, collaborative, and humble – ready to work with a diverse, distributed team to solve interesting problems together.
   
   

Additional Useful Skills And Qualifications


 * You have experience using dbt.
 * You have experience working with political data like state voter files, election results, or data on voter, volunteer, or donor engagement.
 * You have direct experience with voter databases and outreach software such as VAN/ Votebuilder, Scale to Win, or Reach.
 * You have an understanding of how to (and how not to) use predictive modeling, such as Turnout and Support scores.
 * You have experience doing voter outreach or community organizing, either professionally or as a volunteer – bonus points if you’ve knocked doors, made phone calls, sent text messages, or organized your own friends and family to vote.
   
   

$84,000 – $84,000 a year

The salary for the Data Analyst position is $84,000 on an annualized basis, commensurate with experience and qualifications. This is a full-time, exempt position, that may require work on weekends. This position is not eligible for overtime wages and is fully remote.

Benefits: The DNC offers a generous benefit package, including:


 * Generous paid time off, including federal holidays and open leave
 * Health and dental insurance for employee and dependents; 90% paid by the DNC, 10% paid by employee
 * Supplementary vision plans available to employees for purchase
 * Up to a 5% employer match DNC 401(k) plan
 * Pre-tax flexible spending account benefits available to employees and dependents
   
   

The Democratic National Committee (DNC), is committed to diversity among its staff, and recognizes that its continued success requires the highest commitment to obtaining and retaining a diverse staff that provides the best quality services to supporters and constituents. The DNC is an equal opportunity employer and it is our policy to recruit, hire, train, promote and administer any and all personnel actions without regard to sex, race, age, color, creed, national origin, religion, economic status, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity or expression, ethnic identity or physical disability, or any other legally protected basis. The DNC will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination and any such conduct is strictly prohibited.

The Data Quality Analyst is responsible for monitoring client data submissions and communicating with them in the resolution of data quality issues.

Requirements

 * Analyze data to identify patterns and trends over time.
 * Compare data from different categories to identify relationships or correlations.
 * Applying statistical analysis to identify patterns and relationships in the data.
 * Provide context and explanations for the data by using visualizations and narrative descriptions.

GoRev is a leading software development company specializing in the healthcare industry. Our dedicated team has been innovating healthcare software for over a decade, with our flagship product, GoRev, revolutionizing Health Information and Laboratory Information systems. We are committed to embracing new technologies and striving for excellence in everything we do, aiming to be unparalleled in our field. 




Position Overview:

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and presenting healthcare-related data to support internal initiatives and client needs. You will play a key role in the transformation of data into actionable insights that contribute to operational efficiency and data-driven decision making. This role requires strong technical knowledge, a passion for problem-solving, and an eagerness to work in a fast-paced environment.




Responsibilities:




Data Collection and Analysis

· Collect, aggregate, and analyze data from multiple sources including SQL databases, Excel files, flat files, HL7 messages, and JSON structures.

· Develop and maintain SQL queries and scripts to support reporting and analytics needs.

· Assist in the configuration and support of HL7 and other data interfaces.

· Normalize, clean, and transform raw data for in-depth analysis.




Reporting and Visualization

· Develop SQL Queries for custom reporting, normalization of data, and ingestion of data into analytic systems.

· Develop SQL Queries for custom reporting, normalization of data, and ingestion of data into analytic systems.

· Understand and develop analytics specific to healthcare, including but not limited to: days in AR (DSO), profitability analysis, insurance follow-up process effectiveness, user productivity, financials grouped by financial class, chief complaint, coding of primary procedure or diagnosis, and revenue forecasting.




Documentation and Process Support

· Document data relationships and database schemas with limited existing documentation.

· Maintain clear records of queries, analytics processes, and data flow for internal use.

· Collaborate with team members to support efficient data operations and cross-functional projects. 




Qualifications / Requirements:

· High school diploma required; Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field preferred.

· Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational database systems such as PostgreSQL are preferred.

· Strong SQL skills with experience in one or more relational database environments.

· Familiarity with data formats such as HL7 and JSON.

· Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and communication skills.

· Ability to prioritize and complete tasks with minimal supervision.

· 1-2 years of experience with Tableau preferred




Benefits

· Health Insurance

· Dental

· Vision

· Life

· 401K with match

· Paid Time Off 




Reports to: Director of IT Integration and Support

Job Type: Full-time, Non-Exempt

Salary: Hourly with Overtime

description:
About Airship

Airship is trusted by world's leading brands such as Alaska Airlines, BBC and The Home Depot to drive revenue growth and customer loyalty with exceptional cross-channel customer experiences. Today, brands are challenged to deliver seamless, unified customer experiences across a fragmented array of channels and devices— apps, websites, email, SMS, wallets and more.

Airship's no-code, AI-powered platform was designed with non-technical, growth-focused teams in mind, making it easy to create, test and orchestrate hyper-personalized experiences across all channels. With the ability to easily enrich customer data and rapidly launch growth experiments, Airship enables brands to deliver consistent, meaningful interactions that accelerate conversion and foster deeper customer relationships.

We invite you to be part of our journey in building products and delivering services that touch millions of customers around the world every day.

To learn more about us, visit www.airship.com, read our blog or follow us on LinkedIn.

Gummincube, a division of Airship, is looking for an Associate Data Analyst to join our growing Data Analytics team. Gummicube works with top brands around the world, helping optimize search and mobile growth for their apps in the App Store and Google Play. As part of the Data team, you will have the opportunity to impact the success of some of the biggest brands in the Google Play and Apple App Store.

What You'll Do


 * Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and organize client presentations, as well as maintain database/data systems
 * Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns using complex data sets
 * Create and maintain automated reporting dashboards across a large portfolio of clients using Looker Studio and BigQuery
 * Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports
 * Perform data consolidation/data analysis and communicate findings in a clear manner to internal and external, technical and non-technical partners
 * Recommend and implement appropriate performance measures, including lifts, conversion efficiencies, and other statistical metrics to measure campaign success
 * Translate findings into effective and concise, actionable advice by connecting the data to a story
 * Provide support to Analytics team and Ad hoc projects as required
   
   

What We're Looking For


 * 1+ years of experience manipulating large, complex data sets, doing quantitative analysis, data visualization, and dashboarding
 * Knowledgeable about best practices around data manipulation, building data pipelines, feature engineering and creating dashboards
 * Foundation in data analytics and visualization
 * Understanding the importance of delivering value to our clients, not just completing tasks to specs
 * Excellent problem-solving skills
 * Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to technical and non-technical partners
 * Curious, self-motivated, and highly collaborative
 * Flexible and able to jump between several different projects
 * Experience experimenting with AI tools in your personal or professional life - or an eagerness to learn!
   
   

We'd Be Delighted If You Also Have


 * Experience with online ads or mobile marketing
   
   

Work Location & Travel Requirements

Airship's 'Digital First' approach to work means that for the majority of our roles, work can be performed remotely, either some or most of the time. Airship believes that flexible work contributes to a more productive and more equitable work environment, and that Airshippers are able to collaborate, innovate, and support one another across different locations and timezones.

Some roles may require that employees perform their work from a specific location to support business activities, and/or be within proximity to an Airship office location or customer or partner locations, while other roles can be performed 100% remotely.

This position is fully remote and may require up to 10% travel based on business needs or as requested by your manager.

Compensation

Airship's compensation is determined by a variety of factors including market data, business needs, and geography. Base pay is part of your total compensation package and is dependent on multiple factors, including: relevant skills, work experience, business priorities, market demands, and location.

The starting base pay range for this position is: $65,000 - $74,000 USD per year. Some roles may also be eligible for commission, bonus, or other performance incentives. Airship believes that employees should have the opportunity to benefit from value-creation, so equity is also offered with this role. In addition, Airship offers a robust benefits package as part of our Total Rewards approach to compensation.

California residents can view the CCPA disclosure notice here.

Hiring Commitment

Airship is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. We welcome your application and our hiring and employment decisions are made irrespective of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law. In alignment with our commitment to equal opportunity, Airship will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a way that adheres to the principles of fairness and the requirements of local Fair Chance laws, where applicable.

By submitting this application, I affirm that the facts set forth in it are true and complete to the best of my knowledge. I understand that if I am employed, false statements, omissions, or misleading information given in my application, interview(s), or in a background check may result in dismissal.

Media Cause is an award-winning, mission-driven marketing and creative agency that helps nonprofits grow and accelerate their impact. We take a people-first approach to developing powerful creative, scalable growth strategies, and targeted communications that connect with individuals across their entire supporter journey: from awareness and recruitment to fundraising and advocacy, and every touchpoint in between.

As of 2025, Media Cause consists of 50+ full-time employees along with a network of talented consultants. We have offices in Washington DC, Atlanta, and San Francisco, as well as many team members who work remotely on a permanent basis. Our agency has grown in size every year since our founding, landing on the Inc. 5000 list for the fastest-growing private companies in America three times. We have built a strong business, although impact will always be our North Star. In addition to winning a number of creative and effectiveness awards for our client work, Media Cause was also honored by Inc. Magazine with a Best In Business Gold Award for our positive impact on our community, our industry, and society as a whole.

Summary

We're looking for a data-savvy, curious, and adaptable individual to join our Analytics team as a Data & Analytics Specialist. This person will take the reins on daily data operations - managing performance dashboards, wrangling data from media and fundraising platforms, ensuring consistency across our reporting workflows - while also supporting the broader transformation of how our agency leverages data, automation, and AI.

This is a foundational role in a rapidly evolving area of the agency. As part of a small but forward-thinking team, you'll not only be responsible for data integrity and insights delivery, but will also contribute to piloting new tools, workflows, and ideas that will shape the future of nonprofit marketing and agency operations.

If you love building clean dashboards and thinking ahead about how automation and AI can make things better, this role is for you.

This role can be located anywhere in the US.

Core Responsibilities


 * Data Operations & Dashboard Management (80–90%)
 * Own the end-to-end management of internal and client-facing dashboards (e.g. Looker Studio, Google Sheets), ensuring they are accurate, timely, and actionable.
 * Pull and clean performance data from key platforms (e.g. Google Analytics 4, Google Ads, Meta Ads, HubSpot, Salesforce, GoFundMePRO, GiveLively, Fundraise Up).
 * Maintain and evolve our internal data infrastructure - including documentation, shared schema references, and data QA practices.
 * Assist with campaign reporting, URL/UTM builders, and audience/engagement analysis for our paid media, email, and fundraising teams.
 * Serve as the main support for data updates related to client deliverables, including recurring reports and dashboards.
   
   

Strategic & Innovation Support (10–20%)


 * Partner closely with the Director of Data Strategy to explore and implement automation, data pipeline, and AI-driven reporting solutions.
 * Learn and test AI tools that can improve agency workflows - particularly for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
 * Assist in the development and documentation of standardized processes to streamline and scale our agency's data offerings.
 * Bring a strong learning mindset - this role is expected to evolve as the agency's AI and data strategy matures.
   
   

Required

Skills & Qualifications


 * 1–3 years of hands-on experience with data analysis, marketing analytics, or reporting (agency or nonprofit experience a plus).
 * Proficiency with Google Sheets or Excel (advanced formulas, query statements, conditional logic, vlookup/index-match).
 * Experience with GA4, Looker Studio, and pulling data from marketing platforms (manual exports and connectors).
 * Familiarity with AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT, Google Gemini, Zapier) and how they can support workflows, analysis, or automations.
 * Attention to detail and a strong sense of data accuracy and QA.
 * Clear communicator - able to explain data trends and inconsistencies in human terms.
 * Interest in data storytelling and turning insights into impact.
   
   

Nice to Have (or Willing to Learn)


 * Familiarity with or interest in data warehouses (e.g., BigQuery), Coefficient, or Supermetrics.
 * Exposure to Google Tag Manager or Google Ads tracking.
 * Some familiarity with SQL or data transformation scripting.
   
   

Career Path & Growth

This role is ideal for someone who wants to grow from a data executor into a data innovator — someone who thrives at the intersection of spreadsheets, storytelling, and systems thinking. You'll be mentored directly by the Director of Data Strategy and have access to agency-wide conversations around AI, automation, and the future of nonprofit marketing.

As our tools evolve, so will this role - and we're looking for someone excited to grow with it.

Company Perks & Culture


 * Family first work environment with flexible work from home options to accommodate personal obligations
 * Robust health, dental, and vision benefit plans for you and yours
 * 401k & retirement planning
 * Agency-wide profit sharing
 * Unlimited personal time off (with an enforced 3 week minimum every year)
 * 2x/year mental health Fridays to reset and recharge
 * Flexible remote work: We're open to candidates located anywhere in the US and support work getting done wherever it works best for the employee
 * $200/month health & wellness stipend to strengthen your body and/or mind
 * $1,000/year individual professional development stipend to cover any education/training that you want to pursue to grow in your role (or as a human!)
 * Agency commitment to building and supporting a diverse, equitable, and inclusive agency (https://mediacause.org/dei-at-media-cause/) (and we hold ourselves accountable)
 * Transparent & equitable career growth opportunities: Clear path for advancement and opportunity for anyone to raise their hand for promotion every 6 months
 * The ability to work with genuinely fantastic humans who care deeply about the work we do and each other
 * Yearly donations made to employees nonprofit of choice to celebrate their Media Cause work anniversaries
 * A culture of volunteering and giving back to the communities we work in and to the issues we care about around the world
   
   

This is a salaried role commensurate with experience. Media Cause is committed to hiring individuals who are traditionally underrepresented in the field of marketing. We strongly encourage all qualified people to apply.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Position Summary 




The Analyst will be a key cross-functional resource, driving operational excellence, process improvement, and strategic initiatives across the organization. This role requires a highly organized and technically proficient professional with strong project management skills, financial acumen, and the ability to collaborate effectively across multiple departments. The Analyst will develop and enhance Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), interpret and present data insights, manage operational programs, and lead initiatives that improve efficiency, accountability, and results. 




Key Responsibilities 




 * SOP Development & Process Documentation 
 * Identify process gaps and develop SOPs to address operational challenges. 
 * Enhance existing SOPs to improve clarity, efficiency, and consistency. 
 * Partner with subject matter experts to capture institutional knowledge and formalize it into actionable documentation. 
 * Data Analysis & Technology Utilization 
 * Build and interpret dashboards to identify key trends, results, and their impact on functional areas. 
 * Present actionable insights to stakeholders to drive decision-making. 
 * Maintain advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe tools for reporting, presentations, and analysis. 
 * Project Management 
 * Translate strategic objectives into detailed project plans with defined timelines and deliverables. 
 * Coordinate efforts across departments to ensure alignment and timely execution. 
 * Monitor progress, address obstacles, and maintain accountability for outcomes. 
 * Financial & KPI Analysis 
 * Analyze KPIs and financial metrics, linking results to operational drivers. 
 * Provide recommendations to improve performance, efficiency, and cost control. 
 * Operational Program Oversight 
 * Manage budgets for fleet, tools, and other assigned resources. 
 * Ensure cost-effectiveness and operational readiness of assigned programs. 
 * Accountability & Execution Management 
 * Structure workflows and tracking systems to ensure timely completion of tasks. 
 * Hold stakeholders accountable for deliverables and commitments. 
 * Change Management & Special Initiatives 
 * Lead or support organizational change initiatives, ensuring smooth adoption and integration. 
 * Manage special projects, adapting quickly to shifting priorities. 
 * Post-Implementation Reviews & Continuous Improvement 
 * Conduct post-mortem analyses to identify recurring issues and underlying themes. 
 * Develop and implement solutions to prevent recurrence and improve future performance. 




Qualifications & Skills 




 * Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously. 
 * Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe applications. 
 * Strong analytical skills with the ability to connect data insights to business impact. 
 * Demonstrated experience in project management and cross-functional collaboration. 
 * Solid understanding of financial metrics and operational performance drivers. 
 * Proven track record in change management and process improvement. 
 * Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and hold others accountable.

As part of the Strategic Insights team, you will manage and build third party data extracts, and work with internal stakeholders (e.g., Product, Distribution, Finance teams) to develop industry leading Business Intelligence tools to expand Transamerica’s commercial success. Responsibilities include the development and support of the Business Intelligence Analytics products and platforms (e.g., data warehouse, data visualizations and interactive reports).

Responsibilities:


 * Continuously develops and maintains an understanding of Business Intelligence technology and architecture, including data warehousing, dimensional modeling, OLAP functionality, reporting tools, and other methods of information delivery.
 * Develop & maintains expertise with MSBI tools including: Excel/PowerPivot, PowerBI SSRS, PerformancePoint, SSIS, & SSAS/BISM.
 * Develop database and/or data presentation solutions to deliver information to end-users accurately and efficiently
 * Extracts, transforms, & loads data using data management tools and T-SQL.
 * Analyze, understand, and document user needs to ensure accurate fulfillment of user story requests from internal business customers.
 * Generate, analyze and interpret data extracts.
 * Contribute to, and possibly lead, project teams that are developing or modifying highly complex information solutions.
 * Administers & maintains the BI Portal, data warehouse, and existing BI solutions.
 * Continuously develops expertise in the data and data models within the data warehouse, as well as an understanding of supported business domains.
 * May construct data models, data dictionaries, and report glossaries.
 * May conduct user interviews and training sessions
 * May mentor teammates on BI tools and methods.
 * Conducts and may facilitate internal testing and user acceptance testing.
   
   

Qualifications:


 * Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education/experience.
 * Conversational understanding of BI concepts & tools.
 * Demonstrated ability to write SQL/TSQL queries to retrieve/modify data
 * Ability to abstract a concept into a series of lifecycle components and events.
 * Experience/education developing physical dimensional models, OLAP processes or data visualizations OR
 * Experience/education in data modeling, data discovery and the application of data to solve business problems
 * Proven problem solving ability and a willingness to think “outside-the-box”.
   
   

Preferred Qualifications:


 * Experience with PowerBI or other visualization tools.
 * Experience with MSBI tools, including SSRS, SSIS, and/or SSAS
 * Moderate to advanced skills with MS Excel, including Office data connections and pivot tables.
 * Conceptual, logical and/or Physical data modeling experience is a plus
 * Retirement, Life Insurance or Annuity industry experience preferred
 * Working knowledge of multiple IT platforms
 * Ability to anticipate future needs and challenges
 * Has organizational and prioritization skills and effective judgment
 * Can make timely decisions with appropriate information.
 * Has strong communication and relationship building skills.
   
   

Working Conditions:


 * Hybrid - In office Tuesday - Thursday
   
   

Locations:


 * Cedar Rapids, IA
 * Denver, CO
 * Baltimore, MD
 * Philadelphia, PA
   
   

The Salary for this position generally ranges between $62,500 - $75,000 annually. Future Business Intelligence Analyst Opportunity with EquipmentShare!

EquipmentShare is accepting applications for future Business Intelligence Analyst openings in the Columbia, MO area.

At EquipmentShare, we’re always looking ahead - and that means continuously building a pipeline of talented, driven individuals who align with our mission to improve the construction industry through innovation and service. While this posting does not represent a current open position, it allows you to express interest and share your experience with us. By applying here, you’ll become part of our talent network and be among the first considered when future opportunities arise. We’re a company in constant growth and evolution. Let’s build something great together!

EquipmentShare is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst. As a BI Analyst, you will use your data expertise to help departments throughout the company with analytics needs. These projects are wide ranging and could include anything from finance and collections to telematics and fleet data. This new team member may be based anywhere in the United States and offers a remote/hybrid work option, but must be able to meet with management in person at least quarterly.

Primary Responsibilities


 * Become a technical data and reporting expert in a variety of areas to refine and troubleshoot reporting requirements working across teams and domains
 * Build complex queries and data models based on reporting requirements with minimal errors
 * Produce and support dashboards and reports used across the organization
 * Use your strong development and analytical skills to ideate and solve business problems
   
   

Why We’re a Better Place to Work


 * Competitive salary
 * Health insurance and medical coverage benefits
 * 401(k) and company match
 * Unlimited paid time off
 * Stocked breakroom and full kitchen, chef prepared meals daily (Corporate HQ)
 * State of the art onsite gym (Corporate HQ)/Gym stipend for remote employees
 * Volunteering and local charity initiatives that help you nurture and grow the communities you call home
 * Opportunities for career and professional development with conferences, events, seminars and continued education.
   
   

About You

Our mission to change an entire industry is not easily achieved, so we only hire people who are inspired by the goal and up for the challenge. In turn, our employees have every opportunity to grow with us, achieve personal and professional success and enjoy making a tangible difference in an industry that’s long been resistant to change.

Skills & Qualifications


 * Must be qualified to work in the United States - we are not sponsoring any candidates at this time.
 * At least 2 years of experience programming in SQL
 * At least 2 years of experience designing business intelligence reports (e.g. Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik, etc.)
 * Strong attention to detail and quality assurance process
 * Knowledge of an analytical language like Python or R is a plus
 * Proven ability to independently approach complex problems with curiosity and an analytical mindset
 * Ability to adapt quickly, manage competing projects and challenge the status quo
 * A keen understanding of data interpretation and the ability to swiftly extract key insights
   
   

About EquipmentShare

EquipmentShare is dedicated to creating a connected jobsite for the modern contractor. We deliver user-friendly technology solutions that help contractors maximize their equipment uptime, reduce risk exposure and increase productivity. EquipmentShare’s product offerings include an improved equipment rental experience, fleet tracking and asset management software, hardware security solutions and predictive service and maintenance applications.

EquipmentShare is the fastest-growing, independently owned construction equipment rental company in the country. We serve dozens of markets across the U.S. and are on track to create a national footprint in every major market in the country by the end of 2023.

Since our founding in 2014 and incorporation in 2015, we’ve had nationwide growth — and we’re not stopping anytime soon. Ready to support our mission, invest in yourself and discover your potential? Then we’d love to meet you. Apply today.

EquipmentShare is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. EquipmentShare is an equal opportunity

description:
We are looking for a Clinical Registry Data Analyst with a strong combination of clinical insight, analytical rigor, and a passion for improving healthcare outcomes. This role will support the development and evolution of Carta Healthcare’s portfolio of registry-driven products, ensuring the accurate abstraction, analysis, and interpretation of clinical data in ways that drive continuous quality improvement.

As a Clinical Registry Data Analyst, you’ll work closely with clinical stakeholders, product managers, and engineering teams to validate clinical content, refine registry data flows, and optimize abstraction tools. You will bring experience with chart abstraction, a deep understanding of EHR workflows, and a collaborative spirit to help shape clinical data tools powered by LLMs and AI.

Responsibilities


 * Apply clinical judgement and domain knowledge to assess patient-level data, registry metrics, and abstraction quality
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define clinical registry data requirements, identify data quality issues, and propose solutions
 * Monitor and improve data abstraction processes through the use of dashboards, KPIs, and continuous improvement methodologies
 * Conduct root cause analysis, process mapping, and lead PDSA cycles to enhance abstraction quality and workflow reliability
 * Work alongside engineering and research teams to classify error types, define AI model failure modes, and recommend mitigation strategies
 * Support prompt evaluation and tuning for large language models in clinical abstraction contexts
 * Champion quality, accuracy, and usability of registry data products in service of clinicians and data stewards
 * Analyze electronic health record data and measure data availability and quality for clinical registry submission
   
   

What You’ll Need

Clinical Expertise


 * Strong ability to interpret patient records and assess medical relevance of data elements, including diagnoses, labs, medications, and interventions
 * Experience with clinical registry abstraction, including understanding of question sets, case eligibility, and chart review workflows
   
   

Familiarity with how clinical roles (e.g., RNs, abstractors) interact with EHRs and abstraction tools in real-world settings

Data Analysis


 * Fluency working with datasets to evaluate abstraction metrics like precision, recall, and inter-rater reliability
 * Produce comprehensive analytical reports to communicate abstraction quality trends, AI model performance, and recommendations for remediation. Present findings clearly and concisely to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 * Define and maintain a structured error taxonomy to classify model or abstraction failures by type, severity, and likely root cause. This structured approach enables targeted QA efforts and informs both technical and process improvements.
 * Collaborate with engineering, product, and clinical stakeholders to perform detailed error analysis. Trace abstraction errors to specific documentation patterns, ambiguous question logic, or misaligned model outputs.
   
   

Continuous Improvement


 * Proficiency with analyzing abstraction performance using data dashboards and quality metrics
 * Experience with root cause analysis, process mapping, and PDSA cycle execution
   
   

Track record of driving improvements in clinical workflows or data operations

Prompt Engineering

Exposure to large language models and an understanding of prompt design, response tuning, and output evaluation in clinical contexts

Why we love Carta Healthcare, and why you will too!


 * Working on a new, challenging problem space with LLMs/AI/Healthcare
 * Industry leading products
 * Work hard, and have fun doing it
 * Work alongside some of the most talented and dedicated teammates
 * Mission driven
 * Competitive benefits package including great healthcare benefits and 401k
   
   

All applicants require legal authorization to work in the United States now or in the future without sponsorship.

Salary Range: $71,400 to $88, 300

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire. All applicants are required to reside within the continental United States.

Carta Healthcare is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive company because we serve health systems across the country; we’ve seen how our product and impact are strengthened the more we reflect that diversity. In addition, we have found and strongly believe that diverse teams are higher-performing, and we embrace the varied perspectives that our team members share with each other. As such, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:
Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health optimization on a global scale. Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.

Optum Bank is a leading provider of health savings accounts and other financial services. We are committed to helping our clients achieve their financial goals through innovative solutions and exceptional service.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst 2 to join our team. This remote position involves heavy data reporting and presenting key findings to clients and leadership. The ideal candidate will have Solid analytical skills and experience with SQL, Excel, and Power BI.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities


 * Perform complex data analysis and reporting using SQL, Databricks, and Power BI
 * Develop and maintain dashboards and visualizations to support business decision-making
 * Present key findings and insights to clients and leadership
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights
 * Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all reporting activities
   
   

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications


 * 2+ years of data analytics experience
 * 2+ years of credit/financial reporting
 * Experience with Python for data analysis and automation
 * Knowledge of Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports
 * Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation
 * Advanced skills in MS Excel, MS Office product suite, and other technology tools
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Azure Cosmos DB experience
 * Experience in the Financial Services industry such as banking, credit companies
 * Experience combining data from different systems into one report
 * Project management or process improvement experience
 * Proven programming skills for developing custom solutions
 * Proven excellent communication and presentation skills
 * Proven ability to travel occasionally, no more than once per quarter
 * Proven advanced analytical skills
 * All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.
   
   

Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, we offer benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with us, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. The salary for this role will range from $71,200 to $127,200 annually based on full-time employment. We comply with all minimum wage laws as applicable.

Company Description

Are you looking to join an organization that is growing and dynamic? What about a high-energy, collaborative environment that rewards hard work?

J.S. Held is a global consulting firm that combines technical, scientific, financial, and strategic expertise to advise clients seeking to realize value and mitigate risk. Our professionals serve as trusted advisors to organizations facing high stakes matters demanding urgent attention, staunch integrity, proven experience, clear-cut analysis, and an understanding of both tangible and intangible assets.

The firm provides a comprehensive suite of services, products, and data that enable clients to navigate complex, contentious, and often catastrophic situations.

Job Description

We are seeking a Part-Time Consultant to join our Investigative Data Analytics team within our Digital Investigations & Discovery ('DI&D") group in multiple geographical areas. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with project teams on challenging projects, leveraging your expertise in data analysis and client engagement to deliver innovative solutions to complex data-intensive matters and transforming them into actionable insights.

This is a unique opportunity for an entrepreneurial, highly driven person with a well-rounded skill set to join the Investigative Data Analytics team, whose responsibilities extend beyond those of traditional data analysis roles. The ideal person for this role will need to not only have a strong grasp of data analytics but also be flexible and a strategic thinker able to take on a variety of tasks.

Job Responsibilities Include: Analyze and interpret real-world, high-stakes data sets, including historical financial, operational, and transactional data, leveraging your expertise in databases and programming languages (Python, R, Java, SQL, Scala, Julia, or similar). Identify, research, and organize information to ensure data quality and facilitate effective analysis, flagging any potentially sensitive content. Collaborate with senior team members to provide critical support in leading projects, including the identification, collection, processing, review, and production of electronic data for security and regulatory investigations. Contribute to the creation, validation, and presentation of analyses, reports, and other project deliverables, providing valuable insights to clients. Participate in client meetings to discuss project progress, findings, and recommendations, building strong relationships and ensuring client satisfaction. Collaborate with project teams, external professionals, and client staff to coordinate project activities effectively, prioritize tasks, and meet project deadlines while maintaining high-quality standards. About Karbon

Karbon is the global leader in practice management software for growth-minded accounting firms. We provide an award-winning, highly collaborative cloud platform that streamlines work and communication, enabling the average accounting firm using Karbon to save 18.5 hours per week, per employee.

We have customers in 34 countries and have grown into a globally distributed team, with our people based throughout the US, Australia, New Zealand, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the Philippines. We are well-funded, ranked #1 on G2, have a fantastic team culture built on our values, are growing rapidly, and making a global impact.

We are seeking an AI and LLM-powered GTM Analyst/Lead to transform our go-to-market operations by applying advanced AI techniques to uncover and optimize the biggest revenue levers across inbound, outbound, and CSQL channels. This role prioritizes AI-driven analysis of conversion ratios, improving one key metric at a time to compound gains across the funnel. Through LLM-powered time studies and predictive modeling, this role will reveal how GTM teams allocate time, what activities drive customer health, and where AI automation can accelerate pipeline performance. This is initially a 6-month full-time position.

Key Responsibilities

1. AI-Driven Funnel Analysis & Lever Optimization (Primary Focus)

 * Use AI-powered data analysis and LLM-enhanced dashboards to identify the most impactful conversion levers across inbound, outbound, and CSQL funnels.

 * Develop and test LLM-informed hypotheses to improve one ratio at a time (e.g., lead-to-opportunity or win rates).

 * Collaborate with GTM and RevOps teams to operationalize AI-generated insights for measurable improvements.

2. LLM-Powered Time Studies (Primary Focus)

 * Deploy AI models and LLMs to analyze rep activity and time-to-serve by customer segment (e.g., <1-year vs. 1-year+ healthy accounts).

 * Identify repetitive or low-value tasks for automation using AI agents to improve efficiency and focus on high-value activities.

3. Predictive Signal Layer Creation (Secondary Focus)

 * Unify CRM, call, email, product usage, and enrichment data into an AI-driven predictive signal layer that surfaces intent, fit, and timing.

 * Train LLM-based scoring models to enhance account prioritization and sales targeting.

4. Insight Automation with LLMs (Secondary Focus)

 * Use LLMs and embeddings to turn Gong calls, notes, and emails into structured AI-extracted insights.

 * Automate AI-generated summaries of objections, next-best actions, and risk signals for pipeline forecasting.

5. AI-Enabled Playbooks & Dynamic Collateral (Tertiary Focus)

 * Deploy AI and LLM tools to automatically generate personalized collateral (emails, decks, and messaging) tailored to prospect profiles.

 * Implement AI-driven workflows for prospecting, reactivation, and qualification in platforms like HubSpot and Clay.

Qualifications

 * Hands-on experience with AI, LLMs, and vector embeddings, including tools like OpenAI API, LangChain, or similar frameworks.

 * Proven ability to design, implement, and optimize AI workflows for GTM teams, including predictive modeling and automated insights.

 * Strong understanding of data pipelines and unstructured data analysis (e.g., Gong call transcripts, email content) using LLM-based techniques.

 * Expertise in applying LLMs for summarization, insight extraction, and next-best action recommendations within GTM contexts.

 * Familiarity with AI-powered automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot AI, Clay, or custom GPT-based agents).

 * Deep knowledge of GTM tech stacks (e.g., Salesforce, Gong, HubSpot, Outreach) and experience leveraging AI integrations to extract maximum value from these tools.

 * Solid grounding in GTM funnel metrics and the ability to apply AI analytics to improve conversion ratios sequentially.

 * Proficiency in SQL or Python for data manipulation and AI model integration is plus.

Why Work at Karbon

 * Gain global experience across the USA, Australia, New Zealand, UK, Canada and the Philippines

 * Excellent benefits package including:

    * Paid Flexible Time Off with an encouraged 3 weeks use per year
   
    * Company paid medical for you and eligible spouse/partner and dependents
   
    * Company paid dental and vision and eligible spouse/partner and dependents
   
    * Fully company funded short and long term disability
   
    * Fully company paid life insurance
   
    * 401(k) with company matching
   
    * Flexible Spending Account
   
    * Up to 8 weeks paid parental leave
   
    * Work-from-home stipend

 * Work with (and learn from) an experienced, high-performing team

 * A collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity, invests in development and provides consistent feedback

 * Be part of a fast-growing company that firmly believes in promoting high performers from within

As we hire across various locations within the USA we are required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role.The range provided is broad and takes into consideration a wide range of factors that are reviewed when making a hiring decision, such as physical location/cost of living in that location, years of experience, skills, and other business needs.It is not typical for a candidate to be hired at or near the top of the pay range and each compensation decision is dependent on each individual case. The base salary is one component of the total compensation package, which for some roles may include a target bonus, for some roles very competitive equity grant, and very generous benefits. While we believe competitive compensation is a critical aspect of you deciding to join us, we do hope you also spend time considering why our mission, purpose and values are right for you. We are creating something transformational here, and we hope you are as excited about the future as we are!

The estimated base salary range for this role is: : $100,000 USD - $130,000 USD

Karbon embraces diversity and inclusion, aligning with our values as a business. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single criteria. If you've made it this far in the job description but your past experience doesn't perfectly align, we do encourage you to still apply. You could still be the right person for the role!

We recruit and reward people based on capability and performance. We don’t discriminate based on race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion, physical or cognitive ability, and other diversity dimensions that may hinder inclusion in the organization.

Generally, if you are a good person, we want to talk to you. 😛

If there are any adjustments or accommodations that we can make to assist you during the recruitment process, and your journey at Karbon, contact us at people.support@karbonhq.com for a confidential discussion.

 

At this time, we request that agency referrals are not submitted for this position. We appreciate your understanding and encourage direct applications from interested candidates. Thank you!

Position Summary

The Analyst I is a core part of the project team, working at a client location on IE Service consulting projects. The primary role of the Analyst I is collecting various data types in support of client projects at various project sites. Analyst I's must be able to travel 90 % - 100% of the time and work variable shifts, including weekends and evenings.

Duties And Responsibilities

Our expectation is that you model the core values by which the Connors Group operates:


 * Always demonstrate professional and ethical behavior
 * Provide exceptional value to our clients
 * Provide the highest quality of service through your work
 * Contribute to making Connors Group a great place to work
 * Contribute to helping make our communities better places to live
 * Successfully complete data collection activities for various types of studies across multiple industries
 * Professionally communicate with all levels of employees at the client site, and all levels within the project team
 * Responsible for self-time management, progress reporting of tasks to direct project lead and work productively for the assigned observation durations on the client site
 * Travel extensively (90-100%), and sometimes independently, throughout the US
 * Demonstrate initiative, responsibility and analytical thinking
 * Flexibility to work alternative hours, including evenings and weekends
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor of Science degree in Industrial Engineering or other related field
 * Strong work ethic and capability to work independently
 * Strong communication and presentation skills
 * Demonstrated ability to assess and solve problems
 * Working knowledge of MS Office including: Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook
 * Some internship or co-op experience is desired
 * Access to reliable auto transportation and a major US airport
   
   

Working conditions

The Analyst I, at times, must work in challenging, non-standard environments. This could include:


 * Time of day: Evenings (5 PM - 10 PM), overnight shifts (10 PM – 6 AM),

 * Strenuous Activity: Continuous walking throughout the shift, standing on your feet the entire shift
 * Environmental: Client sites with abnormal temperatures, such as but not limited to, above 70°, between 37° and 50°, and below 32°
   
   

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the on-going needs of the organization.

Job Summary:

Fortra is dedicated to nurturing long-term relationships with clients and tackling meaningful challenges in data protection. The Data Protection Analyst will guide clients in understanding their data risk posture and implementing prevention controls while ensuring client satisfaction and retention through regular engagements and data reviews.




Responsibilities:

• Host weekly touchpoints to address concerns, provide updates, and ensure alignment with client goals.

• Conduct comprehensive quarterly business reviews to ensure clients are updated on service performance, product enhancements, and industry trends.

• Regularly perform spot-check data reviews to guarantee accuracy and compliance.

• Engage in meaningful discussions with clients to assess, advise, and improve their data risk posture.

• Guide clients in the understanding and implementation of prevention controls best suited to their needs.

• Collaborate internally to convey client feedback, ensuring our services evolve in line with client expectations and industry shifts.

• Identify upselling and cross-selling opportunities while ensuring client satisfaction and retention.

• Proactively address client issues or concerns, ensuring swift resolution and maintaining trust.

• Other duties as assigned.




Qualifications:




Required:

• Bachelor's degree in Cybersecurity, Information Technology, Computer Science, or related fields. (Or equivalent work experience)

• Familiarity with basic cybersecurity concepts, including malware, phishing, and common attack vectors.

• Basic understanding of data risk management and prevention controls.

• Proficiency in using Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools.

• Familiarity with endpoint protection platforms and related technologies.

• Ability to communicate technical information clearly and succinctly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

• Strong problem-solving ability with an analytical mindset to assess and process vast amounts of data and alerts.

• Ability to work well in a collaborative team environment.

• Prior experience in a customer-facing role, ideally in the managed services or tech industry.

• Stellar interpersonal and presentation abilities

• Capability to interpret data and provide actionable insights.

• Proven track record of building and maintaining strong client relationships.

• Ability to collaborate effectively across internal teams.




Preferred:

• While not mandatory, certifications like CompTIA Security+, CySA+, or similar entry-level security certifications are a plus.




Company:

Fortra provides product training, product services, managed services, and consulting services. Founded in 1982, the company is headquartered in Eden Prairie, Minnesota, USA, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. Fortra has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Location: Remote, NY Category: System Administration Posted On: Tue Aug 12 2025 Job Description:

Position Overview

The Research & Data Associate will assist with OHEP's research projects designed to expand access to higher education for incarcerated and formerly incarcerated people, while assessing outcomes associated with higher education in this population. The associate will engage in conversations with the OHEP team and external stakeholders as the research agenda is developed, create tools to be used for research, help execute that research, and contribute to written reports of findings from research. The Research & Data Associate will also contribute to the ongoing maintenance of data systems within OHEP (e.g. databases and dashboards), enabling an ongoing data-driven approach within OHEP and in the Higher Education in Prison (HEP) space more broadly.

Responsibilities


 * Work with OHEP's data and research team to design and carry out research studies aligned with OHEP's broader research agenda, using both quantitative and qualitative methods.
 * Analyze data from OHEP research studies and translate findings into actionable insights for program and/or policy improvements in the HEP space.
 * Create discussion guides, survey instruments, and other research tools used for the execution of OHEP research studies.
 * Contribute to ongoing maintenance of OHEP data systems, participating in regular data quality checks, writing data system documentation, and refining data dashboards.
 * Work with all members of the OHEP team to integrate actionable research and real-time data to drive program and process improvement, enhancing a data-driven approach.
   
   

Job Requirements

Required Education/Qualifications:


 * Bachelor's degree and 2 years of working experience in social science, or public policy research, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
 * Skilled in communicating research findings to audiences of varying backgrounds, translating findings to actionable insights, both in writing and in presentations.
 * Baseline knowledge and understanding of qualitative and/or quantitative research methods in human-centered research, i.e., research aimed at understanding the needs of users of a product or service.
 * Familiarity with data analysis software (e.g. Excel or similar tools).
   
   

Preferred Education/ Qualifications


 * Master's degree in a social science or public policy related field.
 * Experience writing publication-worthy reports or articles presenting findings from primary research.
 * Demonstrated expertise in designing and carrying out human-centered, IRB-approved research studies.
 * Experience using data analysis and visualization tools (R, Power BI, Tableau).
 * Knowledge of NYS, justice, higher education, policy, or related
   
   

Compensation: $75,000-$80,000

Location: Remote

Who We Are

ServiceMac is a new sub-servicing entity backed by some of the leading practitioners of the mortgage servicing industry. ServiceMac is focused on providing superior technology, products, and services for the mortgage and real estate industries backed by highly personalized service and support. Through continuous innovation and acquisition, our offerings comprise of personalized solutions that span the mortgage continuum and enhance security, compliance, customer satisfaction, and profitability. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for ten consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all.

What We Do

The Regulatory Data Analyst will be responsible for day-to-day production, maintenance, and development of regulatory reports and data solutions at ServiceMac. This role will focus on understanding business processes and data, interpreting customer requirements and specifications, and developing meaningful analysis and reports for ServiceMac and its client regulatory requests. Qualified candidates will have a proven background performing data mining, analysis, and reporting.

What You'll Do


 * Develop operational, management, and exception reports using T-SQL in a controlled, production environment
 * Create ad-hoc reporting for individual regulatory requests and Stored Procedures for production reporting
 * Interpret regulatory requirements into actionable specifications
 * Mine, analyze, and interpret data from multiple sources
 * Work closely with multiple business units to define requirements and validate report results
 * Perform tests for validity, reasonableness, and accuracy through standard methods and application of specific subject-area knowledge
 * Perform regular maintenance and testing on production reports
 * Assist in developing documentation of existing reports, data dictionaries and reference documents
   
   

What You'll Bring


 * 1 - 5 years of recent experience as a data analyst or another related title in a financial or banking environment
 * Formal SQL query language training classes or certificate program
 * Strong proficiency with the SQL query language, preferably Microsoft T-SQL
 * Strong proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite package including an expert knowledge of Excel
 * Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with both internal and external customers, peers, and management
 * Experience with Mortgage Servicing and/or familiarity with MSP as a mortgage servicing platform is preferred
   
   

Salary Range: $75,375.00 - $100,475.00 Annually

This hiring range is a reasonable estimate of the base pay range for this position at the time of posting. Pay is based on a number of factors which may include job-related knowledge, skills, experience, business requirements and geographic location.

What We Offer

By choice, we don’t simply accept individuality – we embrace it, we support it, and we thrive on it! Our People First Culture celebrates diversity, equity and inclusion not simply because it’s the right thing to do, but also because it’s the key to our success.
